person.persName: Curtis Field Burnam (Madison Co. State Rep)

body.p: Richmond, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Richmond native. Son of Thompson Burnam and Lucinda Field Burnam. Married to Sara Rollins Burnam. Father of Anthony R. Burnam, Robert R. Burnam, and Edmund T. Burnam. Graduated from Yale University in New Haven, Connecticut, in 1840. Studied law under Daniel Breck in Richmond, Kentucky. Graduated from law school at Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky, in 1842. Practiced law in partnership with William Clinton Goodloe in Richmond. Member of Richmond Masonic Lodge No. 25 in Richmond. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Madison County from 1851 to 1853 and from 1859 to 1863. Attorney in Richmond in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved people in Richmond in 1860.
